content.description: Start at the low ledge near the base of the slope (as for Heat Lightning). Establish in the crack then use a nice layback hold to get to the lip of the boulder. Mantle onto the slab above.
content.location: Climbs the toe of the boulder at the right (downhill) end.

content.description: Sit start the left end of the boulder at a sharp incut rail and bad feet. Move up increasingly positive holds to the top.
content.location: Left (uphill) end of the boulder at good holds.

content.description: Climbs the obvious left rising crack in the center of the boulder. Sit start low ledge near the base of the slope. Move up to finger crack and then left as the crack turns into a sloping rail. Finish up good holds near the left side of the boulder.Â
content.location: Climbs the obvious left rising crack in the center of the boulder.

content.description: Small boulder with a really cool crack climb. The toe of the boulders dips into a vernal pool. Sadly, the base of the boulder stays wet most of the year. Definitely worth a visit during dry spells.
